      void createBoard()
      The method creates the game board by asking for a String, if the board can´t be created, it calls for a new String

      void executeOperation(int operation)
      The method executes the operation the user has chosen
      pre: The creation of the methods: createBoard and play post: Calls a method or closes the program
      void play()
      The method waits for a String input from the console, and does something according to said input
      if the input is menu, it returns to the menu if the input is num, it calls the method printString from the class ManageBoard if the input is simul, it calls the method simul from the class Menu if the input is help, it prints the possible options the user can choose from if the input is a line jump, it calls for the method actionPlayer from the class ManageBoard if the input is anything else, it asks for a new input pre: The creation of the methods: actionPlayer and printString, from the class ManageBoard and the method simul from the class Menu post: Executes a method depending of the input
      void recursionMenu()
      The method uses recursion to create a menu through the console
      pre: The creation of the methid waitForOption post: gives a value to the method waitForOption

      The method prints the menu and returns the option the user chooses

      The method uses the game to play the game until someone has won
      pre: the creation of the method actionPlayers post: The addition of a new Player object in the team's player array, and the same object added to the clubEmployees ArrayList

      The method uses n to choose one of the options in the menu and then recursion to call it´s self

      • play

        public void play()
          throws java.io.IOException
        The method waits for a String input from the console, and does something according to said input
        if the input is menu, it returns to the menu if the input is num, it calls the method printString from the class ManageBoard if the input is simul, it calls the method simul from the class Menu if the input is help, it prints the possible options the user can choose from if the input is a line jump, it calls for the method actionPlayer from the class ManageBoard if the input is anything else, it asks for a new input pre: The creation of the methods: actionPlayer and printString, from the class ManageBoard and the method simul from the class Menu post: Executes a method depending of the input
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the bw or br don't work correctly
